alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 10 at 7:42AM EST until November 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Statement, minor coastal flooding. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Collier County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Statement, through Friday morning. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
